newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil August exports at $4.381 billion - ministry.
newsitem.headline: Brazil August exports at $4.381 billion - ministry.

text.p: Brazilian exports during the month of August totalled $4.381 billion, down 3.88 percent on exports of $4.558 billion in the same month a year ago, the Industry and Commerce Ministry said.
The ministry said exports for the January-August period totalled $31.759 billion compared with $30.011 billion in the same period in 1995.

The ministry said in a statement that despite exports in August being lower than last year, the daily average of $199.1 million was a record for the month. It noted that August 1996 only had 22 working days while August 1995 had 23.
Primary commodities constituted 27.66 percent of the August exports, semi-manufactured goods were 17.87 percent, and manufactured goods 53.44 percent.
The ministry said exports of commodities registered record levels for the month, exceeding August 1995 by 11.81 percent, principally due to exports of soybeans.
Soybean exports amounted to $472 million in August.
